job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Hi there!
   We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product - a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don't miss your chance.
   This is our Machine Learning Engineer role for those who want to turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic.

   Tasks in the role

     * Full project development cycle: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring
     * Development of classification/ranking/regression/clustering models
     * Working with LLM: Embeddings, prompt engineering, model fine-tuning
     * Supporting the infrastructure for conducting experiments, storing results, retraining models, quality monitoring, and alerting
     * Working with data providers' APIs
     * Code review, We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain. We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products. Our team includes a Product Owner, a Technical Owner, three Data Scientists, and two MLOps Engineers. The workload is increasing, so we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer.

   Our stack:
     * Google Cloud Platform
     * Data Storage: ClickHouse, CloudSQL
     * Language: Python
     * Tools: Airflow, k8s, Docker, DVC, FastAPI, Catboost, Pandas
     * LLM APIs: OpenAI, Google, Anthropic

   We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

     * It's up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both
     * Flexible working day start
     * Unlimited PTO
     * Hobby benefit
     * Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
     * Corporate events
     * Training, courses, conferences
     * Gifts for employees
job_details.full_text:
Machine Learning Engineer (DS Team)

Hi there!
   We are Semrush, a global IT company developing our own product - a platform for digital marketers. New stars are born here, so don't miss your chance.
   This is our Machine Learning Engineer role for those who want to turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic.

   Tasks in the role

     * Full project development cycle: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring
     * Development of classification/ranking/regression/clustering models
     * Working with LLM: Embeddings, prompt engineering, model fine-tuning
     * Supporting the infrastructure for conducting experiments, storing results, retraining models, quality monitoring, and alerting
     * Working with data providers' APIs
     * Code review, We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain. We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products. Our team includes a Product Owner, a Technical Owner, three Data Scientists, and two MLOps Engineers. The workload is increasing, so we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer.

   Our stack:
     * Google Cloud Platform
     * Data Storage: ClickHouse, CloudSQL
     * Language: Python
     * Tools: Airflow, k8s, Docker, DVC, FastAPI, Catboost, Pandas
     * LLM APIs: OpenAI, Google, Anthropic

   We will try to create all the right conditions for you to work and rest comfortably

     * It's up to you to decide what work format works best for you. You can #wfo, #wfh, or mix both
     * Flexible working day start
     * Unlimited PTO
     * Hobby benefit
     * Breakfast, snacks, and coffee at the office
     * Corporate events
     * Training, courses, conferences
     * Gifts for employees

profile_classification.rationale: The job description emphasizes the development of classification, ranking, regression, and clustering models, aligning with the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer. While LLM work is mentioned, it's in the context of embeddings, prompt engineering, and fine-tuning, which can be part of an ML Engineer's toolkit when applied to predictive tasks. The role also includes full project development cycles, model deployment, monitoring, and supporting infrastructure, all key aspects of an ML Engineer focused on productionizing models. The technologies listed, such as Python, GCP, Airflow, Docker, and Catboost, further support this classification.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Development of classification/ranking/regression/clustering models' directly refers to the creation and training of predictive models.
The phrase 'Working with LLM: Embeddings, prompt engineering, model fine-tuning' indicates tasks related to adapting and utilizing generative models, which falls under modeling.
job_tasks.phrase: Working with LLM: Embeddings, prompt engineering, model fine-tuning

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Supporting the infrastructure for conducting experiments, storing results, retraining models, quality monitoring, and alerting' describes the setup and maintenance of systems for production ML models.
job_tasks.phrase: Supporting the infrastructure for conducting experiments, storing results, retraining models, quality monitoring, and alerting

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Working with data providers' APIs' implies tasks related to data ingestion and integration, which are part of data engineering.
The phrase 'Code review' is a standard software development practice.

The phrase 'We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain. We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products.' shows an understanding of how ML services support broader product development within a specific domain (SEO).
job_tasks.phrase: We are a data science team responsible for supporting teams working in the SEO domain. We create internal services using machine learning, based on which other teams implement new products.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Full project development cycle: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring' encompasses the entire lifecycle of an ML model, including deployment and monitoring, which are MLOps responsibilities.
job_tasks.phrase: Full project development cycle: From problem statement and research to experiments, model deployment, and monitoring

soft_skills.phrase: turn ideas into reality using code, algorithms, and maybe a bit of magic
